title: Fix invisible metric values in Hero stats section

requirements.text: Fix the HeroSection metric/value text so numeric values render visibly (Years Experience, Forecast Accuracy, Tools Mastered, Projects Completed) by correcting the gradient text class usage that currently makes the text transparent without a valid background gradient.

quotes: I am not able to see anything in this attached section first fix this.

acceptanceCriteria: In the Hero metrics grid, all four metric numeric values are visible in light mode and dark mode.
Values remain visible across mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.
No metric value text uses `text-transparent` unless it also has a working gradient background applied (or an equivalent visible text color fallback).

requirements.text: Ensure any other HeroSection gradient-text elements using the same invalid class (e.g., tagline and the floating 95% card) render visibly by either (a) replacing `bg-gradient-accent` with the existing `gradient-accent` utility where used with `bg-clip-text text-transparent`, or (b) adding a CSS utility alias so `bg-gradient-accent` produces the intended gradient background.

quotes: I am not able to see anything in this attached section first fix this.

acceptanceCriteria: The Hero tagline text (“Turning data into actionable insights”) is visible.
The floating overlay stat value (95%) is visible.
No new console errors or Tailwind class resolution issues are introduced.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/immutablePaths (including frontend/src/main.tsx and the Internet Identity/actor hooks).
Keep the fix production-safe and compatible with Tailwind + existing global CSS utilities.
nonGoals: Do not change the metric numbers/labels or add new portfolio sections.
Do not address resume download or /messages authorization in this build request (focus only on the invisible attached/stats section as requested).

preferencesToAdd: Use English for any user-facing text.
